cotton.network

Interface NetworkHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultNetworkHandler, NetworkHandlerStub

    public interface NetworkHandler
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Implementing this interface enables a class to act as a network handler. The NetworkHandler manages the network traffic by creating SocketAddress connections and sending data.

    Each Cotton instance needs a NetworkHandler to pass traffic between nodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.net.SocketAddress getLocalAddress()
      Returns the local SocketAddress of the running machine.
      void send(NetworkPacket netPacket, java.net.SocketAddress dest)
      Sends data wrapped in a NetworkPacket over the network.
      void sendKeepAlive(NetworkPacket netPacket, java.net.SocketAddress dest)
      Sends a NetworkPacket and informs that the connection should stay alive.
      void setInternalRouting(InternalRoutingNetwork internal)
      Sets the interface to push data to the rest of the system
      void stop()
      Asks all connections to shutdown and turns off the NetworkHandler.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run
